article: You and I have principles. And we also have opinions. I have opinions about what I think is _ or wrong, good or bad. But they're only _ ---I could be wrong! I won't try to _ my life around my opinions, but I will try to _ my principles. A 15-year-old boy learned a(n) _ lesson about principles. On his way home he found a _ that contained $127 and the owner's identification. _ hesitation, he hopped onto his bicycle and went over to the owner's _ ---about a mile away. He told her that he had _ her wallet and she gave him a big hug and twenty dollars. That evening the boy told his parents about what had happened. However, his father said, "I don't think you should have _ $20 for doing what you should do. A person shouldn't be _ for being honest.". He thought about his father's _ and decided he would return the money. He returned to the lady's home and _ her back the twenty dollars. She didn't want to take it, but he told her she _ to , for his father pointed out _ to him that he had never _ before. When principles _ our decisions and actions, we actually change. These great principles _ our lives and make us into persons of character. That boy is _ to be raised by a wise father who had the _ to say, "Those are my principles."
